Categories: MET Values: Minutes Spent: Hours Spent:
Activity MET Score Hours Spent Calories Burned
Bicycling Conditioning Dancing Fishing & Hunting Home Activities Lawn & Garden Miscellaneous Music Playing Occupational Running Self Care Sexual Activity Sports Walking Water Activities Winter Activities CUSTOM
\"TDEE\" stands for \"Total Daily Energy Expenditure,\" which is a fancy way of counting how many calories you burn each day.\n\n\"BMR\" stands for \"Basal Metabolic Rate,\" and represents how many calories you burn while doing absolutely nothing (e.g. sitting motionless, sleeping).\n\nThis calculator will show your BMR based upon your physical composition, and approximate your TDEE based on your level of daily activity.
\"MET\" stands for \"Metabolic Equivalent of Task,\" and is used to approximate how many calories per minute various tasks burn. A 1.0 value is equivalent to doing absolutely nothing (e.g. sitting motionless, sleeping).\n\nThis calculator will show the MET value of your chosen activity, in addition to the calories it burns when engaging in it for the chosen duration.\n\nPlease note, these values are approximations only.\n\nSource: Barbara E. Ainsworth, William L. Haskell, Stephen D. Herrmann, et al., \“2011 Compendium of Physical Activities: A Second Update of Codes and MET Values,\” Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise, Aug. 2011
